title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: What scientists need to know about sharing—and protecting—their published work
items.description: With research papers becoming increasingly free to read and use, understanding open-access licenses is key

items.title: Killer whales groom each other—with pieces of kelp
items.description: In a newly discovered form of social tool use, orcas scratch each other’s backs with seaweed

items.title: Rubin observatory unveils first images taken with its giant mirror and camera
items.description: Pictures are a prelude to a transformative, all-sky survey set to begin in months

items.title: Culture literally changes how we see the world
items.description: Where city dwellers see rectangles, people who live in round huts see circles

items.title: Always ‘one atom away’: The long, rocky journey to an HIV prevention breakthrough
items.description: Developing lenacapavir, the drug newly approved to protect against HIV for six months in one shot, took basic science, sophisticated chemistry, and perseverance

items.title: No sour faces: How birds evolved to eat highly acidic fruits
items.description: Genetic mutations more than 20 million years ago helped birds tolerate the tart and broaden their diets

items.title: New approach enables body to engineer its own cells to fight cancer or autoimmunity
items.description: Injections of mRNA may offer a simpler, cheaper way to build powerful CAR-T cells

items.title: For the first time, women scientists win $1 million climate research prize
items.description: Following criticism for all-male winners in the past, women earned two of the three Frontiers Planet Prizes this year

items.title: This giant, all-seeing telescope is set to revolutionize astronomy
items.description: The Vera C. Rubin Observatory will build an unprecedented map of the universe—and discover billions of fast-changing objects

items.title: Updated: Trump administration unfreezes, then refreezes, NIH funding to Columbia University
items.description: Morning agency email indicating resumption of hundreds of millions in grants is quickly undone
